array.string: I. Global/Regional Dysfunction and Structural Alterations
II. Tissue Characterizations of Wall
III. Repolarization Abnormalities
IV. Depolarization and Conduction Abnormalities
V. Arrhythmias
VI. Family History
2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change ≤ 33%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF ≤ 40%
RV Angiography: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm

2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 29 to < 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 16 to > 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 32 to < 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 18 to < 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change > 33% and ≤ 40%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm with ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥100 to < 110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 90 to < 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF > 40% to ≤ 45%

Residual myocytes < 60% by morphometric analysis (or < 50% if estimated) with fibrous replacement of RV free wall myocardium in ≥ 1 sample, with or without fatty replacement of tissue on endomyocardial biopsy

Residual myocytes 60% to 70% by morphometric analysis (or 50% to 60% if estimated) with fibrous replacement of RV free wall myocardium in ≥ 1 sample, with or without fatty replacement of tissue on endomyocardial biopsy
T wave inversion (V1, V2, and V3) or beyond in individuals > 14 yrs (in absence of complete RBBB)
T wave inversion in V1 and V2 in individuals > 14 yrs (in absence of complete RBBB) or in V4, V5, V6
T wave inversion in V1-V4 in individuals > 14 yrs in presence of complete RBBB
Epsilon wave (reproducible low-amplitude signals between end of QRS complex to onset of T ave) in right precordial leads (V1-V3)

Late potentials on SAECG (standard ECG QRS <110 msec): Filtered QRS duration ≥ 114 msec OR duration of terminal QRS < 40 µV (low amplitude signal duration) ≥ 38 msec OR Root-mean-square voltage of terminal 40 msec ≤ 20 µV
2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change ≤ 33%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF <= 40%
RV Angiography: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm

2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 29 to < 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 16 to > 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 32 to < 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 18 to < 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change > 33% and ≤ 40%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm with ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥100 to < 110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 90 to < 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF > 40% to <= 45%
2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change ≤ 33%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF <= 40%
RV Angiography: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm

2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 29 to < 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 16 to > 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 32 to < 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 18 to < 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change > 33% and ≤ 40%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm with ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥100 to < 110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 90 to < 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF > 40% to <= 45%
